history.title: Story and Goal
history.lore: The newly crownd king of Tavilia, per tradition must appoint a new Imperial mage to serve as his advisor. But in this era where magic and technology are becoming more and more intertwined, the king has decided to hold a competition to determine who will be worthy of Imperial mage title. So many mages have come across the land to the capital to compete, will you be the one to earn this prestigeous title?
history.goal: The goal of Mage Towers is to ||collect enought mana|| to be the first player to successfully use an ||Incantation|| or by the end of the turn after the ||Deck|| has been depleted, to have the most amount of ||infused Catalyst blocks|| in your Tower.

cards.title: The cards of Mage Towers
cards.text: There are ||4 type of cards|| in Mage Towers:
cards.blocks: ||Blocks||, as the name implies, are used to build your Tower. You can only ||place one of them each turn|| so choose wisely. The ||Catalyst|| is the most important block, as it is the only one that can be used to produce stable and ||collectable mana||.
cards.glyphs: ||Glyphs||, are used to produce mana. Either by ||infusing|| Catalysts or using them directly to gain a single mana of the appropriate type ||until the end of your turn||.
cards.spells: ||Spells||, are used to cast powerful effects. They can be used to help you or hinder your opponents. The first level of each spell does not require anything and can be used outright. To level up a spell, you must use the ||required amount of mana|| or ||sacrifice glyphs and spells|| of the same magic type.
cards.utilities: ||Utilities||, require nothing to be used and may come in handy in certain circomstances.
cards.look_cards_long: Take a look at all the cards in the game on the dedicated page
cards.look_cards: Look at all the cards here

setup.title: Setup
setup.intro: To start a game of Mage Towers, you will need a base ||deck of Mage Towers|| with 72 cards and a ||counting sheet|| to keep track of the mana for each player. The base pack has every card you need for a ||duel between two players||. If you want to play with ||more players||, you will need to ||add more cards to the deck||.
setup.look_deck: You can find the deck composition needed for the amount of players you want to play with here
setup.setup: In the middle of the table, place a ||row of 6 cards facing down|| and below a ||row of 6 cards facing up||. The row of cards facing up is called the ||Market|| and the row with the cards facing down is called the ||Street||, the whole set is called the ||Bench||. The rest of the cards go in the draw pile.
setup.distribution: Choose the first player at random. The ||first player is given 5 cards||, and every other player is given an ||extra card depending on their place in the turn order||. So the second player gets 6 cards, the third 7 and so on.

gameplay.title: Gameplay
gameplay.text: The game is played in turns. At the begining of your turn, start by picking a card from the ||Market|| or 2 from the ||Street||. Then, you can ||play as many cards as you want|| from your hand but you can only ||place one block|| per turn. Unless specified every card played or discarded is placed face up on the discard pile. During your turn can also convert 2 ||Creation mana|| into 1 mana of any type. ||When you are done, draw 1 card|| from the draw pile and pass the turn to the next player. Every time you pick cards from the ||Bench||, fill the empty spaces with cards from the draw pile.
gameplay.pick_cards: Pick a card from the Market or 2 from the Street
gameplay.play_cards: Play as many cards as you want
gameplay.convert_mana: Convert some Creation mana if needed
gameplay.end: Draw 1 card and pass the turn
gameplay.count: Write down the mana points you gained on the counting sheet

mana.title: Mana
mana.intro: There are ||5 types of mana|| in Mage Towers. The ||Creation mana|| is the most rare and powerful of them, it can  be converted into any other type of mana and although it doesn't have an Incantation glyphs of Creation can level up spells of any type. The other 4 types of mana are ||Destruction||, ||Arcane||, ||Chaos|| and ||Order||. They are far more common and can be used to level up spells of their respective type.
mana.gain_mana: There are 3 main ways to gain mana in Mage Towers:
mana.catalysts: ||Block -|| At the end of your turn, each ||Catalyst|| block in your tower will produce ||one mana|| of the type they are infused with
mana.spells: ||Spells -|| Using spells such as ||Sacrifice|| will give you permanent mana
mana.glyphs: ||Glyphs -|| Using a glyph will give you mana of it's type until the end of your turn
mana.reminder: Remember that all the mana you gain from your ||Blocks and Spells is permanent|| (don't forget to write it down), but the mana you gain from using ||Glyphs is only available until the end of your turn||.

catalysts.title: Build your Mage Tower
catalysts.intro: ||Once per turn|| you have the opportunity to ||place a block|| in your tower. Each block is ||placed on the table above the previous one|| in a column representing the construction of your tower. Each player can only build ||one tower||, so be carefull when planning your construction because ||some blocks have placement restrictions||.
catalysts.catalyst: The most essential block of your tower is the ||Catalyst|| as it is your primary way of getting mana. You can play it in combination with ||1 common glyphs|| (Destruction, Arcane, Order, Chaos) or ||2 Creation glyphs|| to infuse it. If you do, place the glyphs above or next to the Catalyst on the table to indicate the type of mana it will produce. At the end of your turn, each Catalyst block in your tower will produce one mana of the type of mana they are infused with.
catalysts.change_infusion: During your turn, you can also choose to ||change or assign a new type of infusion|| to your Catalyst. To do this, place the previously infusing glyphs in the discard pile if there were any, and then place 2 identic glyphs on the Catalyst. ||This action cannot be performed with glyphs of Creation||.
catalysts.tip: As you might have understood, not imidiatly infusing a Catalyst with glyphs could cost you more contact in the future so plan accordingly.

spells.title: Spells
spells.intro: Each spell in Mage Towers has serveral levels of power. The first level of each spell does not require anything and can be used outright. To level up a spell you can:
spells.addendum: Any of those actions will level up the spell to the next level. They can be used in any order and in any amount, so you can mix and match them as you see fit.
spells.mana: ||Use the a mana|| of the same type as the spell
spells.sacrifice: ||Discard a spell|| of the same type
spells.glyph: ||Use or discard a glyph|| of the same type

incantations.title: Incantations
incantations.intro: Using an ||Incantation|| is the main way to win in Mage Towers. It can only be used during your turn and, you must have enought mana to use it and meet its ||specific requirements||. Here is the list of ||Incantations|| you can use:

destruction.name: Apocalypse
destruction.effect: On use your turn ends, you ||can no longer play any card and your turn is skipped||. If in the next ||2 turns|| no other player uses an Incantation or if the ||draw pile is emptied||, ||you win the game||.

arcane.name: Arcane Atunement
arcane.requirements: Costs ||10 Arcane mana||, you must have an ||Observatory|| in your tower for at least a turn.

chaos.name: Mass Manipulation
chaos.requirements: Costs ||7 Chaos mana||, you must have an ||Observatory|| in your tower for at least a turn and have the ||tower with the least amount of Catalysts||.

order.name: Celestial Order
order.effect: On use your turn ends. Until the end of the game, if no other player uses an Incantation, you win when your ||total amount of mana matches an other player|| or if the ||draw pile is emptied||.

incantations.addendum: In the case of an Incantaiton beeing used after an ||Apocalypse|| or a ||Celestial order||, the victor is the Incantation use r with ||the most infused Catalyst blocks|| in his tower.

composition.title: Deck composition
composition.intro: The base pack of Mage Towers has 72 cards and is designed for a duel between two players. If you want to play with more players, you will need to add more cards to the deck. You can choose to use the ||fast|| or the ||slow|| configuration depending how fast you want the game to. But we encourage you to ||try both|| and see which one you prefer and even ||create you own||. Let us know on social media what your favorite configuration is!
composition.warning: The game has been well tested from ||2 to 4 players||, few games have been played with more but going over 6 players is not recommended but possible.
